metadata.prompt: A fun graphic where single-use items (an emery board, a cotton ball, an orangewood stick) are shown with little superhero capes, flying into a trash can. The title reads "The Unsung Heroes".
A macro shot of a drop of water instantly absorbing into the surface of a paper towel, visually explaining what 'porous' means.
A clear graphic with three icons: a tree (for wood), a piece of paper, and a cotton ball. Text below reads: "Porous Materials = Single-Use".
A shot of a nail technician's drawer, but it's filled with used, dirty-looking emery boards and used orangewood sticks. A big, red, animated 'X' stamps over the drawer.
A satisfying shot of a gloved hand decisively dropping a used emery board into a hands-free trash can after a service.
A shot of a nail technician opening a brand new, sealed pack containing a new file and sterile cotton swab for a client, showcasing perfect hygiene.
The phrase "WHEN IN DOUBT, THROW IT OUT" appears in big, bold, friendly letters on the screen, holding as the final message.
